sentences.en: After all this, the bottle of wine inside the silk bag could only be an anticlimax.
sentences.cn: 这一番隆重的仪式过后, 丝袋内的那瓶酒可能并非你想象中的那么令人兴奋.

sentences.en: Before the listener knows where he is, the mounting tension is lifted in a pianissimo anticlimax.
sentences.cn: 在听众不知不觉之间, 紧张气氛在最弱音的突减中被提升了.

sentences.en: Going back to work after a month travelling in China was bound to be an anticlimax.
sentences.cn: 在中国旅行了一个月之后再回去工作必然很没劲。

sentences.en: In fact, one of the most common game failures is anticlimax.
sentences.cn: 实际上, 游戏最常见的失败之一便是渐趋平淡.

sentences.en: It was an anticlimax when they abandoned the game.
sentences.cn: 他们放弃比赛,真是扫兴.

sentences.en: It was sad that his international career should end in such anticlimax.
sentences.cn: 令人悲哀的是，他的国际职业生涯竟如此惨淡收场。

sentences.en: The circus act came as anticlimax after the big build up given by the ring master.
sentences.cn: 在马戏团领班的大捧场后,这个马戏院团的表演却出现了令人扫兴的结尾.

words.tran_cn: 虎头蛇尾的；突降法的；突减的
突降法；虎头蛇尾；令人扫兴的结尾

trans.tran_cn: 突降法，虎头蛇尾，苍白无力的结尾，令人扫兴的结尾
trans.tran_en: a situation or event that does not seem exciting because it happens after something that was much better
